snippet: The C.I.A.’s decision to send a vaccination team into Pakistan to obtain DNA from Osama bin Laden’s family had the unintended consequence of hurting work there against polio.
abstract: Global leaders of the war on polio say it remains unclear how much their national campaign in Pakistan, where the disease has never been eradicated, has been hobbled by fallout from a CIA operation that sent a fake vaccination team to gather information from Osama bin Laden's compound; leaders remain critical of the operation, which aroused widespread suspicion of aid workers in the country.
lead_paragraph: The C.I.A.’s decision to send a vaccination team into Pakistan to obtain DNA from Osama bin Laden’s family had the unintended consequence of hurting work there against polio.

headline.seo: C.I.A. Vaccine Ruse in Pakistan May Have Harmed Polio Fight
headline.main: C.I.A. Vaccine Ruse May Have Harmed the War on Polio
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Vaccine Ruse May Have Harmed the War on Polio
